name: Open Contracting Partnership
headAddress: Open Contracting Partnership, 641 S Street NW
memberOrga: OCP is a non-membership based organization.
goal:
The Open Contracting Partnership brings together open data and open government to make public contracting reforms more agile, more impactful and more durable.

We work in over 30 countries around the world supporting systemic reforms, helping innovations jump scale and fostering a culture of openness about the policies, teams, tools, data, and results needed to power change.

Our activities:

- Advocacy that challenges vested interests and changes the global norm in public contracting from closed to open.

- Support for a network of partners who implement open contracting projects and the adoption of the Open Contracting Data Standard.

- Learning how and why open contracting works and gathering compelling evidence of what open contracting can achieve.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Digital economy and society, European Neighbourhood Policy, Fraud prevention, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market
euInitiatives:
OCP promotes open contracting approaches among the EU Member States and the EU institutions, including the adoption of a unified public procurement data architecture and implementation of open contracting principles.

In that light, OCP is mostly interested in Public Procurement and Artificial Intelligence strategies as well as Digital and Open Data agendas.
